what: Time Dependent Shared Frailty Cox Model
title: Time Dependent Shared Frailty Cox Model
text: TimeDepFrail ultimate R package fitting analyzing Time-Dependent Shared Frailty Cox Models. models extend traditional Shared (Gamma) Frailty Cox Models incorporating time-dependent frailty component, making robust tool studying unexplained heterogeneity data evolves time. package implements methods discussed “Centre-Effect Survival Bone Marrow Transplantation: Application Time-Dependent Frailty Models” C.M. Wintrebert et al. (2004).

title: Time Dependent Shared Frailty Cox Model
text: can install development version package GitHub:

title: Time Dependent Shared Frailty Cox Model
text: data_dropout dataset used exemplify package. tracks academic progress students enrolled 2012 three academic years (six semesters). dataset aims explore factors leading student dropout. dataset composed four variables: Gender: Categorical covariate indicating gender (Male Female). CFUP: Numeric covariate representing standardized number credits CFUs (Credito Formativo Universitario) passed student first semester. time_to_event: time (semesters) student decides drop . value greater 6.0 means student drop follow-period. group: Categorical variable representing student’s course study, 16 levels CosA CosP. Students followed maximum 6 semesters (3 academic years), start lectures drop follow-ends.

title: Time Dependent Shared Frailty Cox Model
text: fit Time-Dependent Shared Frailty model, following elements required: dataset data.frame, e.g. data_dropout time_axis vector: time intervals model applied. example, data_dropout dataset, events occur first semester, time_axis starts end first semester (t = 1) ends end third year (t = 6). categories_range_min categories_range_max vectors: Provide minimum (categories_range_min) maximum (categories_range_max) bounds parameter category constrain optimization. formula object: Specify relationship time--event, covariates, group. clustering variable (group), must provided cluster(group) formula. elements prepared, can call desired model using AdPaikModel() function. PowParModel() StocTimeDepModel() also available, secondary models room performance improvements. full examples, refer Examples/ModelsApplication.R script. Additionally, guidance selecting model parameters time_axis, categories_range_min categories_range_max, recommend basing choices insights gained fitting Time-Unvarying Shared Frailty model. can find relevant example ExamplesTimeUnvarying.R.

title: Time Dependent Shared Frailty Cox Model
text: Several built-methods available analyze results fitted model: Baseline Hazard Step-Function: plot_bas_hazard() Frailty Standard Deviation/Variance: plot_frailty_sd() Posterior Frailty Estimates: plot_post_frailty_est() Model Summary: summary() methods provide insightful visualizations summaries help interpret model results effectively. Furthermore, also support function suitable choice range parameters analysis 1D log-likelihood available, AdPaik_1D().

title: Time Dependent Shared Frailty Cox Model
text: AdPaikModel model optimized fast computation although estimating certain coefficients (e.g., Male versus Female) may vary slightly computational time. Note changing reference category (e.g., using Male baseline) alters coefficient estimates overall log-likelihood model fit. Users choose reference categories based interpretability rather performance. ‘Centre-Specific Frailty Model Power Parameter’ (PowParModel) slower AdPaikModel, produces coherent expected results. ‘Stochastic Time-Dependent’ Centre-Specific Frailty Model’ (StocTimeDepModel) computationally heavy may converge easily.

title: Adapted Paik et al.'s Model: Time-Dependent Shared Frailty Cox Model — AdPaikModel
text: Two observation needs made time-domain: time domain may coincide follow-may contained . Indeed, left boundary can greater beginning follow-, instance, can coincide time-instants events begin happen; conversely, right boundary two must . partition time domain intervals can made according two selected criteria: (1) using already existent partition follow-(2) using shape baseline hazard function reference: divide time-domain according regions peak plateau. parameters respect log-likelihood function must optimized : baseline log-hazard (number parameters = number intervals time-domain) data regressors \(\mu_1\), \(\nu\): parameters gamma distribution \(\alpha_j\) (time-independent/constant) (2 parameters) \(\gamma_k\): parameters gamma distribution \(\epsilon_{jk}\) (time-dependent) (number parameters = number intervals) Another model parameter \(\mu_2\) get imposing constraint \(\mu_1 + \mu_2 = 1\). can notice, parameters can grouped category (regressors, baseline log-hazard ) can easily constraint assigning category minimum maximum range. category vector structured follows: (baseline log-hazard, regressors, \(\mu_1\), \(\nu\), \(\gamma_k\)) dimension (n_intervals, n_regressors, 1, 1, n_intervals). output model call 'AdPaikModel(...)' S3 object class 'AdPaik', composed following quantities: formula: formula object provided input user specifying relationship time--event, covariates dataset (regressors) cluster variable. Regressors: categorical vector length R, name regressors. different original covariates dataset case categorical covariates. Indeed, categorical covariate n levels needs transformed (n-1) dummy variables , therefore, (n-1) new regressors. NRegressors: number regressors (R) ClusterVariable: name variable respect individuals can grouped. NClusters: number clusters/centres (also indicated N). NIntervals: number intervals time-domain, also called L. corresponds length time-domain minus 1. NParameters: number parameters model. can computed : \(n_p = 2L + R + 2\). ParametersCategories: Numerical vector length 5, containing numerosity parameter category. ParametersRangeMin: Numerical vector length \(n_p\), giving minimum range parameter. ParametersRangeMax: Numerical vector length \(n_p\), giving maximum range parameter. Loglikelihood: value maximized log-likelihood function, optimal estimated parameters. AIC: 'Akaike Information Criterion': can computed \(AIC = 2n_p - 2ll_{optimal}\). gives idea loss information related model fitting output. smaller , less loss information better model accuracy. Status: Logical value. model reach convergence? , variable TRUE, otherwise FALSE. NRun: Number runs necessary reach convergence. model reach convergence, number equal maximum number imposed runs. OptimalParameters: numerical vector length \(n_p\), containing optimal estimated parameters , words, parameters maximizes log-likelihood function. StandardErrorParameters: numerical vector length \(n_p\), corresponding standard error estimated parameters. ParametersCI: S3 object class 'ParametersCI', composed two numerical vector length equal \(n_p\): left right 95\ interval estimated parameter. FrailtyStandardDeviation: numerical vector length equal L (.e. number intervals time-domain), reporting standard deviation frailty. PosteriorFrailtyEstimates: S3 object class 'PFE.AdPaik'. See details. PosteriorFrailtyVariance: S3 object class 'PFV.AdPaik'. See details. PosteriorFrailtyCI: S3 object class 'PFCI.AdPaik'. See details. object class 'PFE.AdPaik' contains Posterior Frailty Estimates computed procedure indicated reference paper composed three elements: 'alpha': posterior frailty estimates \(\alpha_j, \forall j\). vector length equal number centres. 'eps': posterior frailty estimates \(\epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). 'Z': posterior frailty estimates \(Z_{jk} = \alpha_j + \epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). object class 'PFV.AdPaik' contains Posterior Frailty Variances computed indicated reference papaer  composed three elements: 'alphaVar': posterior frailty variance \(\alpha_j, \forall j\). vector length equal number centres. 'epsVar': posterior frailty variance \(\epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). 'ZVar': posterior frailty variance \(Z_{jk} = \alpha_j + \epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). object class 'PFCI.AdPaik' contains Posterior Frailty Confidence Interval composed two elements: left confidence interval estimated \(\hat{Z}_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). right confidence interval estimated \(\hat{Z}_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L).

code: # Consider the 'Academic Dropout dataset' data(data_dropout) #> Warning: data set ‘data_dropout’ not found  # Define the variables needed for the model execution formula <- time_to_event ~ Gender + CFUP + cluster(group) time_axis <- c(1.0, 1.4, 1.8, 2.3, 3.1, 3.8, 4.3, 5.0, 5.5, 5.8, 6.0) eps <- 1e-10 categories_range_min <- c(-8, -2, eps, eps, eps) categories_range_max <- c(-eps, 0, 1 - eps, 1, 10)  # \donttest{ # Call the main model result <- AdPaikModel(formula, data_dropout, time_axis,                       categories_range_min, categories_range_max, TRUE) #> Error: object 'data_dropout' not found # }

title: One-dimensional analysis of log-likelihood function — AdPaik_1D
code: # Consider the 'Academic Dropout dataset' data(data_dropout) #> Warning: data set ‘data_dropout’ not found # Define the variables needed for the model execution formula <- time_to_event ~ Gender + CFUP + cluster(group) time_axis <- c(1.0, 1.4, 1.8, 2.3, 3.1, 3.8, 4.3, 5.0, 5.5, 5.8, 6.0) eps <- 1e-10 categories_range_min <- c(-8, -2, eps, eps, eps) categories_range_max <- c(-eps, 0, 1 - eps, 1, 10)  # Choose the parameter with respect to which you want to study the \ # log-likelihood function and provide its position in the parameter vector \ # for identifying a parameter existence range  index_param_to_vary <- 1  # Call the main model without providing optimal parameter result <- AdPaik_1D(formula, data_dropout, time_axis,                     index_param_to_vary, FALSE, NULL,                     categories_range_min, categories_range_max, n_iter = 5) #> Error: object 'data_dropout' not found  # or for studying the log-likelihood behaviour.

title: Check structure of the 'AdPaikModel' output — check.result.AdPaik
text: output model call 'AdPaikModel(...)' S3 object class 'AdPaik', composed 18 quantities: formula: formula object provided input user specifying relationship time--event, covariates dataset (regressors) cluster variable. Regressors: categorical vector length R, name regressors. different original covariates dataset case categorical covariates. Indeed, categorical covariate n levels needs transformed (n-1) dummy variables , therefore, (n-1) regressors. NRegressors: number regressors (R) ClusterVariable: name variable respect individuals can grouped. NClusters: number clusters/groups/centres NIntervals: number intervals time-domain, also called L. corresponds length time-domain minus 1. NParameters: number parameters model. can computed : \(n_p = 2L + R + 2\). ParametersCategories: Numerical vector length 5, containing numerosity parameter category. ParametersRangeMin: Numerical vector length \(n_p\), giving minimum range parameter. ParametersRangeMax: Numerical vector length \(n_p\), giving maximum range parameter. Loglikelihood: value maximized log-likelihood function, optimal estimated parameters. AIC: 'Akaike Information Criterion': can computed \(AIC = 2n_p - 2ll_{optimal}\). gives idea loss information related model fitting output. smaller , less loss information better model accuracy. Status: Logical value. model reach convergence? , variable TRUE, otherwise FALSE. NRun: Number runs necessary reach convergence. model reach convergence, number equal maximum number imposed runs. OptimalParameters: numerical vector length \(n_p\), containing optimal estimated parameters , words, parameters maximizes log-likelihood function. StandardErrorParameters: numerical vector length \(n_p\), corresponding standard error estimated parameters. ParametersCI: S3 object class 'ParametersCI', composed two numerical vector length equal \(n_p\): left right confidence interval estimated parameter. FrailtyStandardDeviation: numerical vector length equal L (.e. number intervals time-domain), reporting standard deviation frailty. PosteriorFrailtyEstimates: S3 object class 'PFE.AdPaik'. See details. PosteriorFrailtyVariance: S3 object class 'PFV.AdPaik'. See details. PosteriorFrailtyCI: S3 object class 'PFCI.AdPaik'. See details. object class 'PFE.AdPaik' contains Posterior Frailty Estimates computed procedure indicated reference paper composed three elements: 'alpha': posterior frailty estimates \(\alpha_j, \forall j\). vector length equal number groups/centres. 'eps': posterior frailty estimates \(\epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). 'Z': posterior frailty estimates \(Z_{jk} = \alpha_j + \epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). object class 'PFV.AdPaik' contains Posterior Frailty Variances computed indicated reference papaer  composed three elements: 'alphaVar': posterior frailty variance \(\alpha_j, \forall j\). vector length equal number groups/centres. 'epsVar': posterior frailty variance \(\epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). 'ZVar': posterior frailty variance \(Z_{jk} = \alpha_j + \epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). object class 'PFCI.AdPaik' contains Posterior Frailty Confidence Interval composed two elements: left confidence interval estimated \(\hat{Z}_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L). right confidence interval estimated \(\hat{Z}_{jk}, \forall j,k\). Matrix dimension (N, L).

what: Frailty standard deviation and Variance for the 'Adapted Paik et al.'s Model' — frailty_sd.AdPaik
title: Frailty standard deviation and Variance for the 'Adapted Paik et al.'s Model' — frailty_sd.AdPaik
text: function computes standard deviation variance time-dependent frailty 'Adapted Paik et al.'s Model'. Recalling frailty structure \(Z_{jk} = \alpha_j + \epsilon_{jk}\) composed constant group-dependent term (\(\alpha_j\)) time group dependent term (\(\epsilon_{jk}\)), frailty standard deviation (variance) can computed two different way: Considering time-dependent spread clusters/groups/centre: \(sd(Z_{jk}) = \mu_2 * \gamma_k\). case, flag_fullsd FALSE. Considering time-dependent constant spread clusters: \(sd(Z_{jk}) = \mu_1 * \nu + \mu_2 * \gamma_k\). new added term moves upward case flag_fullsd TRUE. final case depends want observe.

title: Frailty standard deviation and Variance for the 'Adapted Paik et al.'s Model' — frailty_sd.AdPaik

code: # Consider the 'Academic Dropout dataset' data(data_dropout) #> Warning: data set ‘data_dropout’ not found  # Define the variables needed for the model execution formula <- time_to_event ~ Gender + CFUP + cluster(group) time_axis <- c(1.0, 1.4, 1.8, 2.3, 3.1, 3.8, 4.3, 5.0, 5.5, 5.8, 6.0) eps <- 1e-10 categories_range_min <- c(-8, -2, eps, eps, eps) categories_range_max <- c(-eps, 0, 1 - eps, 1, 10)  # \donttest{ # Call the main model result <- AdPaikModel(formula, data_dropout, time_axis,                       categories_range_min, categories_range_max, TRUE) #> Error: object 'data_dropout' not found  frailty_sd(result, TRUE) #> Error: object 'result' not found frailty_sd(result, FALSE) #> Error: object 'result' not found # }

title: Plot the Posterior Frailty Estimates — plot_post_frailty_est.AdPaik
text: result S3 object class 'AdPaik', returned method call 'AdPaikModel(...)'. data Dataset (dataframe) variables formula object must found contained. flag_eps Logical flag indicating whether plot time-dependent posterior frailty estimates. Default FALSE. flag_alpha Logical flag indicating whether plot time-independent posterior frailty estimates. Default FALSE. xlim Numeric vector length 2 specifying x-axis limits. Default based number intervals. ylim Numeric vector length 2 specifying y-axis limits. Default (0, 10). xlab, ylab String giving x y axis name. Default values 'Intervals' 'Values'. main_title Title plot. Default title 'Posterior frailty estimates'. cex Dimension points used plotting estimates. pch_type Numerical vector length equal number clusters data, giving symbol used plotting estimates. Default symbol (circle, 21) clusters. color_bg Numerical vector length equal number clusters data, giving color used plotting symbols estimates. Default ('black') faculties. hand, color used throughout intervals faculty. cex_legend Dimension symbol legend. Default 0.7. pos_legend Either numeric vector providing x y coordinates legend string specifying legend's position (e.g., 'bottomright', 'bottom', 'bottomleft', 'left', 'topleft', 'top', 'topright', 'right', 'center').

title: Plot the Posterior Frailty Estimates — plot_post_frailty_est.AdPaik
text: plot posterior frailty estimates.

title: Plot the Posterior Frailty Estimates — plot_post_frailty_est.AdPaik
text: Recalling frailty structure \(Z_{jk} = \alpha_{j} + \epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\) posterior frailty estimate \(\hat{Z}_{jk} = \hat{\alpha}_{j}/\hat{\alpha}_{max} + \hat{\epsilon}_{jk}/\hat{\epsilon}_{max}\), function allows plotting either entire posterior frailty estimate \(\hat{Z}_{jk}\) time-independent \(\frac{\hat{\alpha}_{j}}{\hat{\alpha}_{\text{max}}}\) time-dependent \(\frac{\hat{\epsilon}_{jk}}{\hat{\epsilon}_{\text{max}}}\) components. user can control components display using flag_eps flag_alpha parameters. one flags can set TRUE time.

title: Plot the Posterior Frailty Estimates — plot_post_frailty_est.AdPaik
code: # Import data data(data_dropout) #> Warning: data set ‘data_dropout’ not found  # Define the variables needed for the model execution eps_paik <- 1e-10 categories_range_min <- c(-8, -2, eps_paik, eps_paik, eps_paik) categories_range_max <- c(-eps_paik, 0.4, 1 - eps_paik, 1, 10) time_axis <- c(1.0, 1.4, 1.8, 2.3, 3.1, 3.8, 4.3, 5.0, 5.5, 5.8, 6.0) formula <- time_to_event ~ Gender + CFUP + cluster(group)  # Call the main model function  # \donttest{ result <- AdPaikModel(formula, data_dropout, time_axis, categories_range_min, categories_range_max) #> Error: object 'data_dropout' not found  # Define variables for plotting the estimates pch_type <- c(21, seq(21,25,1), seq(21,25,1), seq(21,25,1)) color_bg <- c("darkblue", rep("red", 5), rep("purple", 5), rep("green",5))  plot_post_frailty_est(result, data_dropout,                       xlim = c(0, 11), ylim = c(0,3),                        pch_type = pch_type, color_bg = color_bg,                       pos_legend = 'bottomright') #> Error in plot_post_frailty_est(result, data_dropout, xlim = c(0, 11),     ylim = c(0, 3), pch_type = pch_type, color_bg = color_bg,     pos_legend = "bottomright"): could not find function "plot_post_frailty_est"  # }

what: Posterior frailty estimates and variances for the 'Adapted Paik et al.'s Model' — post_frailty.AdPaik
title: Posterior frailty estimates and variances for the 'Adapted Paik et al.'s Model' — post_frailty.AdPaik
text: Function computing posterior frailty estimates variances time-dependent shared frailty Cox model. Recalling structure frailty \(Z_{jk} = \alpha_j + \epsilon_{jk}, \forall j,k\) composed sum two independent gamma distributions: \(\alpha_j \sim gamma(\mu_1/\nu, 1/\nu), \forall j\) \(\epsilon_{jk} \sin gamma(\mu_2/\gamma_k, 1/\gamma_k), \forall j,k\) posterior distribution terms still gamma different mean variance posterior frailty estimate corresponds 'empirical Bayes estimate', previous mentioned posterior mean.
